pageContext.description: High rounded mid-rib grooved on either side. Grooved at the bevel. Also 2 grooves leave the midrib grooves & expand towards 2 rivet holes (4 in all). There are 2 horn shaped plates on each face above the nicked shoulders which are ornamented with bordering dots. Parallel grooves connect the rivet holes.
pageContext.surface: Smooth except for one patch which is bright green - a few green encrustations. Smooth part dull metal.
pageContext.collection: Museum of Archaeology + Ethnology, Cambridge,from the Collection of W. Marlborough Prior of Western Stevenage, Herts.
